message.content:
cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.DS. 

The paper deals with a communication problem involving noisy observations of a Gaussian source, rate-constrained communication, and distortion measures. This falls under the information theory (cs.IT) sub-category. The use of logarithmic loss distortion measure and the application of the results to related problems suggest a connection to machine learning (cs.MM) and statistical learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The mention of side information and conditional independence also suggests a connection to signal processing (cs.SI) sub-category. Finally, the use of information bottleneck problem suggests a connection to data structures and algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category.
